DOC.brief_summary: The investigators want to find out whether a recently introduced combination of two blood pressure lowering agents (olmesartan and amlodipine) has a different blood pressure lowering effect than a single active substance. In addition the investigators want to find out whether there is a difference in the changes in blood pressure over the course of a day depending on the time when the medications are taken (in the morning or at night). Male and female patients over 18 years of age may participate.
DOC.brief_title: Sevicontrol-1: Efficacy and Safety of a Fixed Combination of Olmesartan/ Amlodipine
DOC.detailed_description: Investigation of changes in blood pressure after six weeks therapy with a fixed combination of 40 mg olmesartan and 10 mg amlodipine compared to a monotherapy with 32 mg candesartan. Investigation of changes in dipping-profile after a further six weeks of therapy with the fixed combination when time of intake is switched from morning to evening.
